result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor Trevon Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/25/2016.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work, medical treatment and AODA treatment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no  longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Trevon Gray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant regarding return of property.
Letter from defendant regarding return of property.

ADDRESS INFO for Carolyn Vance
Current: 1329 West Locust Street, Apt 30, Milwaukee, WI 53206-2608 United States  (Effective: 04-15-2015)
Prior: 3768 N 13th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States
now printed.

Defendant Victor Trevon Gray in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case heard on return of property petition.  Petitioner Carolyn V. present.

Court granted the petition for return of property.  Order signed and filed.

Defendant Victor Trevon Gray not in court, defendant in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Petitioner appeared, pro se.  State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Denis Stingl

Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Petititioner needs to provide proof of ownership. Case calendared for contested hearing on 9-12-14 at 8:30 in Branch 47.  Return of property hearing scheduled for 09-12-2014 at 08:30 am.
Return of property hearing on August 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 07/29/14. AR

Defendant Victor Trevon Gray in court with attorney Amy Catherine Scholz. Marissa Santiago for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 10 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 60 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, medical treatment and AODA treatment.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/25/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/25/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviciton Relief
MPD Inventory #14015163(CAROLYN VANCE).

Defendant Victor Trevon Gray in court with attorney Amy Catherine Scholz.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 7/25/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
14RM030742  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 06-17-2014
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Amy C Scholz in court, defendant Victor Trevon Gray not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests bail be amended down, arguments heard, Court does NOT amend bail.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.
for Bail Reduction of Modification, received and filed. sab
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Victor Trevon Gray in court with attorney .  Defendant Victor Trevon Gray in custody.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Nathaniel Adamson for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #F881390 that are attached to the complaint .Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective. Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Victor Trevon Gray in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Defendant Victor Trevon Gray in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
